Secretary. f&RTCULTURAL11 POLICY.(previous reference erence:Cabinet 42(30), Con-clusion 2.)Statutory QuotaBritish. wheat in Flour .(previous reference:Cabinet 27(30), Con-elusion 3.)The agricultural marketing Pill.(previous reference:Cabinet 27(30), Con-elusion 3.)1. The Cabinet had before them the sameMemoranda as at their previous Meeting, and continued their discussion o^ Agricultural Policymainly in relation to the proposed Wheat Quota.A^ter a comprehensive discussion, in vhich thereasons for and acainst the proposed Wheat Quotawere set out in full, the Cabinet agreed That a Cabinet Committee, composed as follows:-The Minister o^ Agriculture and % 'f"Fisheries (In the Chair). /"The Home Secretary,The First lord of the Admiralty,The Secretary o^ State for Scotland,The Minister o"^ Education,with the Chancellor o^ the duchy of Lancaster as a' ConsultativeMember -should meet -for the purpose of pre-paring, not a Memorandum, but aseries o^ Resolutions for theconsideration o^ the Cabinet, onthe following subjects:-(a) The proposed TT^heat Quota.(b) The Agricultural marketing bill. THB london naval TREATY ,(previous reference:Cabinet 35(PC), Con-elusion 5.)2. In vie?, of the favourable atmospherecreated for the London Naval Treaty by thedecision of the United States Senate on theprevious day to approve the ratification o"*the Treaty, and the recent Debate in the Houseof Commons on the Treaty, the Cabinet agreed -(a) That the London Naval treaty should at once be ratified byHis Kajesty's Government in theUnited Hi ng d or. .:(b) That the Prime Minister should arrange, by Private Notice question and Answer, to announce thisdecision the sa--3 day:(c) That the Prime Minister should arrange *or the London naval treaty Bill to be taken in theHouse of Commons on the following day, with a view to obtainingSecond Reading . 3. The Secretary of State for Foreign affairs read to the Cabinet a telegram from the HighCommissioner in Egypt (Mo. 347, of July SI, 1930)which had reached him during the Meeting and whichhe felt to be 0* such importance that the cabinet ought to be acquainted at once with its contents.Pie said that he would advise them at the Meetingof the Cabinet on the following day as to theaction to be taken on the telegram. UNEMPLOYMENTINSURANCF.(Pr eviousReferenee:Cabinet 41(20), Con-elusion 5.)2, Whitehall G?gardens, S."'.:.l,July 22, 19 30.That the Lord Privy Seal andthe Minister of transport should be available to take part in the Debate on theUnemployment Insurance Pillon the following day, if desired by the Minister ofLabour.
